name: Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning
mission: Our mission is to teach people how to explore, understand, discuss, and practice Islam based on reason, rationality, and objective thinking.
programs: 23 Questions Series: Application of Core Principles
theoryOfChange: The Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning, an initiative of Al-Mawrid United States Inc., has a published "Strategic Plan" as of September 13, 2022. This plan outlines high-level objectives and action steps. Their vision is to educate people about Islam as presented by Prophet Muhammad, aiming to separate history and culture from religion and teach it as a field of knowledge based on reason and logic, valuing critical thinking. The strategic objectives include providing research and an educational environment for the evolution of religious thought, translating existing research, supporting further research projects, educating children and adults through online and on-premises courses, creating audio/visual content, disseminating content via social media, reaching out to local communities, and providing forums for students to critically evaluate opinions and ask questions. Their methodology emphasizes exploring, understanding, discussing, and practicing Islam based on reason, rationality, and objective thinking, valuing research over blind belief, and evidence over opinion. For instance, their Sunday School program is designed to instill positive character traits and cultivate critical thinking in students through a comprehensive curriculum divided into stages.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

all_citations.claim: AL-Mawrid United States Inc holds a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 75.2%.
The charity is ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE and maintains a specific zakat policy for donors.
The organization reported total revenue of $816,038 and operates programs including AskGhamidi and various translations.
The organization provides multiple giving methods and confirms its status for receiving zakat contributions.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity maintains a solid financial foundation with a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100, though its overall score is moderated by its focus on advocacy and capacity building which can be harder to quantify than direct aid.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing impact measurement data to better reflect the long-term outcomes of capacity-building programs
Increasing transparency regarding specific beneficiary reach across global translation projects

dimension_explanations.alignment: AL-Mawrid offers a medium fit for traditional donors, specifically catering to those seeking rationalist Islamic education and scholarship [2]. Its status as ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE provides a clear pathway for Muslim donors to contribute to educational advocacy, which is categorized as an area of high cause urgency within intellectual development [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates moderate impact through its focus on capacity building and education, operating with a total revenue of $816,038 and a program expense ratio of 75.2% [1][3]. While it maintains strong financial health and efficiency, the nature of its work in advocacy and intellectual discourse results in a more indirect impact profile compared to emergency relief services [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: AL-Mawrid United States Inc empowers individuals to explore and practice Islam through the lenses of reason, rationality, and objective thinking.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 75.2%, ensuring the majority of funds support educational initiatives
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 10.9 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in the United States, this organization focuses on religious education and intellectual discourse through its AskGhamidi platform and various translation programs [1][3]. The charity is recognized as ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through its dedicated zakat policy [2][4].

Value rational and objective approaches to Islamic jurisprudence
Prefer funding educational infrastructure and translation over direct aid
Seek to fulfill zakat through the fisabilillah category
giving_considerations: Donations support high-level intellectual work rather than immediate physical relief
The organization is small-to-mid-sized with a stable but non-growing budget
Focus is primarily on the English and Urdu speaking global diaspora
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-volume humanitarian relief or those who prefer traditional, non-reformist religious institutions.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks <cite id="12">five outcome metrics</cite> and provides external evaluation documents to Candid.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization aims to create a research environment where Islamic thought can evolve through <cite id="22">rational inquiry and education</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in advocacy ensures that educational content is actually reaching and influencing the target audience.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With flat revenue growth, the organization has capacity to expand its translation and digital reach with new funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>, which outperforms the <cite id="7">peer median of 81.5%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">75.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward its educational and advocacy programs, exceeding industry standards.
It costs the charity only <cite id="8">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, demonstrating lean administrative operations.
The charity has earned a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure available.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Mawrid US demonstrates significant financial stability with <cite id="10">10.9 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, ensuring continuity for its long-term translation and research projects. Its governance is marked by <cite id="11">100% independent board members</cite>, which supports objective oversight. Furthermore, the organization has successfully integrated its religious mission with modern accessibility, providing <cite id="12">five distinct outcome metrics</cite> to track its impact on religious literacy and intellectual engagement.
rich_narrative.summary: Al-Mawrid United States Inc, also known as the Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning, is a religious advocacy and educational organization that promotes an intellectual approach to Islam. Founded in <cite id="1">2014</cite>, the organization focuses on <cite id="2">reason, rationality, and objective thinking</cite> in religious discourse. The charity operates primarily through its AskGhamidi platform, offering <cite id="3">educational classes, Sunday schools, and fatwa services</cite> to a global audience. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $816,038</cite> in the 2023 tax year, with a significant portion of its funding coming from <cite id="5">$704,499 in public contributions</cite>. The charity maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>, which is higher than the <cite id="7">peer program ratio median of 81.5%</cite> for similar advocacy groups. This efficiency is further evidenced by its <cite id="8">fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating that the vast majority of donor funds are directed toward its core mission of religious education and translation projects.
